title.narrative: Kenya Social and Economic Inclusion Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the Social and Economic Inclusion Project for Kenya is to strengthen delivery systems for enhanced access to social and economic inclusion services and shock-responsive safety nets for poor and vulnerable households. It has three component. First component, Strengthening Social Protection Delivery Systems will support the enhancement of the existing Social Protection (SP) delivery systems established under the ongoing National Safety Net Program (NSNP) and will aim to further consolidate the Consolidated Cash Transfer Program (CCTP) 25 under the State Department of Social Protection (SDSP), and Hunger Safety Net Programme (HSNP) under the National Drought Management Authority (NDMA), within a consistent and coherent delivery system. Second component, Increasing Access to Social and Economic Inclusion Interventions will contribute to the Government of Kenya (GoK's) goal of universal health coverage by establishing and supporting a functional referral mechanism to improve NSNP beneficiaries access to the National Hospital Insurance Fund (NHIF) and expand nutrition-sensitive safety net services to additional counties; and Third component, Improving the Shock Responsiveness of Safety Net System will support the NDMA to expand HSNP coverage and improve the shock responsiveness of the safety net system, including financing arrangements for timely support to vulnerable households affected by climate induced risks.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Labour and Social Protection

condition.narrative: Schedule 2 Section I.B.1 - To facilitate implementation of Part 1 and 2 of the Project, the Recipient shall, by not later than nine(9) months after the Effective Date, establish and operationalize management information system modules for the: (a) NICHE; and (b)and economic inclusion interventions, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

Schedule 2 Section IV.A - Without limitation upon the provisions of Section 2.01(b) of the General Conditions, the Recipient shall,by not later than three (3) months after Effective Date, open bank accounts for the Project in accordance with detailedarrangements set out in the Disbursement and Financial Information Letter.

title.narrative: Beneficiaries of social safety net programs
Number of sub-counties where economic inclusion model is initiated
IRI 1: Percentage of beneficiaries receiving payments through the new Inua Jamii Payment Mechanism for the Consolidated Cash Transfer Program
IRI 5: Establishment and implementation of referral mechanism for the NHIF

baseline.value: 30 percent of NSNP households enrolled in the NHIF but no systematic referral system in place

target.value: 90 percent of NSNP beneficiaries enrolled in the NHIF

title.narrative: IRI 7: Percentage of payments that are made on time to Payment Service Providers for transfer to regular HSNP beneficiaries
IRI 6: Number of households receiving package of nutrition-sensitive social protection services
Number of households receiving nutrition-sensitive cash transfer
IRI 8: Percentage of regular HSNP cash transfers financed by the GoK in the original four HSNP counties
Number of counties where the roll out of enhanced Single Registry covers at least 75 percent of targeted households

baseline.value: An SR, linked to the MIS of four cash transfer programs, is functional with links to the IPRS

target.value: Roll out completed in 39 non HSNP counties

title.narrative: IRI 2: Integrated G&CM mechanism is strengthened and rolled out at decentralized level

baseline.value: G&CM system for all four NSNP programs piloted in 20 sub-counties

target.value: Enhanced G&CM functional in all KSEIP counties

actual.value: Phase 1- partial training (virtual) of 745 field officers from DSD, DCS & NCPWD in 47 counties

title.narrative: IRI 9: HSNP registration exercise in original and expansion counties completed

baseline.value: HSNP re-registration in four original counties has commenced

target.value: HSNP registry updated and linked with enhanced SR according to design and operating procedures

actual.value: Registration of households is delayed due to Covid-19 restriction measures.

target.value: Updated HSNP scalability strategy in place

actual.value: HSNP scalability strategy developed and forwarded to NDMA board for approval.

title.narrative: Enhanced financing mechanism for HSNP scalability is implemented

baseline.value: No formal financing plan in place

target.value: Emergency payments made for 100% of households triggered in HSNP 8 counties

actual.value: Financing plan for HSNP scalability has been adopted for FY19/20 and updated for FY20/21.

title.narrative: Beneficiaries of social safety net programs - Female
Number of new regular HSNP households enrolled and paid for through the GoK's budget in expansion counties
IRI 3: Beneficiary Outreach Strategy for NSNP and KSEIP rolled out

baseline.value: BOS for the CCTP rolled-out in 20 sub- counties

target.value: Enhanced BOS rolled out in all 47 counties

actual.value: Inputs on eBOS zero draft submitted to consultant for improvement of documents; Next steps stakeholder review of draft 1 of e BOS;Engagement with Directorate of Social Development to capture Economic Inclusion components in the e BOS.
